titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory of the Carol Sklenicka Collection of Raymond Carver Materials, 1930s-2014, bulk 2000-2009 SPEC.RARE.0098
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Karen Glenn; Anna Arays; Olivia Spencer; Katy Scullin

publicationstmt.publisher: Ohio State University Libraries Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-02-28T17:15-0500

did.unittitle: Carol Sklenicka Collection of Raymond Carver Materials

repository.corpname: Ohio State University Libraries Special Collections

did.abstract: As of 2015, Carol Sklenicka is a biographer and essayist based in California. She is best known for her biography of Raymond Carver, "Raymond Carver: A Writer's Life," published in 2009.The Carol Sklenicka Collection of Raymond Carver Materials contains materials acquired by Carol Sklenicka while performing research for her biography of Raymond Carver, “Raymond Carver: A Writer's Life.” The collection materials date from the 1930s-2014, with the bulk of materials dating 2000-2009.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of Materials
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is arranged in the order it was received. It is arranged alphabetically by topic in the first four boxes. Thereafter, materials are grouped by document type, such as legal, publishing, and interview transcripts, including related research notes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Carol Sklenicka Collection of Raymond Carver Materials, SPEC.RARE.0098, Rare Books and Manuscripts Library, Ohio State University

accessrestrict.head: Access to Materials
accessrestrict.p: Some materials in boxes 5 and 15 have restricted access and are not available for research until 2020. Materials in box 22 are restricted and may not be viewed without prior curatorial consent. The remainder of this collection is available for patron research, but may be used only in the Thompson Library Special Collections reading room.

userestrict.head: Use of Materials
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be protected by copyright, and are made available for research and educational purposes. In general, the OSU Libraries do not own the copyright for materials from our collections and cannot grant copyright permissions for these materials. The user is responsible for making a final determination of copyright status. If copyright protection applies, permission must be obtained from the copyright holder to reuse, publish, or reproduce the work beyond the bounds of fair use or other exceptions to the law. Works in the public domain are not protected by copyright and do not require permission to use.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection is unprocessed; Finding aid written by Karen Glenn, Anna Arays, Olivia Spencer, 2015 November; Katy Scullin, 2018 February

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Carol Sklenicka is a biographer and essayist based in California as of 2015. She is best known for her biography of Raymond Carver, "Raymond Carver: A Writer's Life," published in 2009. It has been described as the first comprehensive work on Raymond Carver's life and writings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Carol Sklenicka Collection of Raymond Carver Materials contains articles, publisher drafts and edits, photo albums, legal documents and research notes related to Raymond Carver personally and professionally. The materials were acquired by Carol Sklenicka while doing research for a biography of Raymond Carver. The collection dates from the 1930s-2014, with the bulk of interview and other research notes from 2000-2009.
